context: The University is organized into <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b6_0><b9_0>eleven<b9_0/><b6_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/> separate academic units<a3_0/>—ten faculties and the Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study—with campuses throughout the <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>Boston<a0_2/><a0_1/> metropolitan area<a0_0/>: its <b7_0>209-acre (85 ha)<b7_0/> main campus is centered on <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>Harvard Yard<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> in Cambridge, approximately <b8_0>3 miles (5 km) northwest of Boston<b8_0/>; the business school and athletics facilities, including Harvard Stadium, are located across the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Charles<a2_2/><a2_1/> River<a2_0/> in the Allston neighborhood of Boston and the medical, dental, and public health schools are in the Longwood Medical Area. Harvard's <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b5_0>$37.6 billion<b5_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> financial endowment is the largest of any academic institution.
